drug.name: DP-b99
drug.description: DP-b99 is a newly developed lipophilic, cell permeable derivative of BAPTA (1,2-bis(2-aminophenoxy)ethane-N,N,N',N'-tetraacetic acid), that is under development as a neuroprotectant for the potential treatment of stroke, head trauma and neurological damage associated with coronary artery bypass graft.

article.citation: Rosenberg G, Angel I, Kozak A: Clinical pharmacology of DP-b99 in healthy volunteers: first administration to humans. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 2005 Jul;60(1):7-16.
Yeung PK: DP-b99 (D-Pharm). Curr Opin Investig Drugs. 2004 Jan;5(1):90-4.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in strokes and traumatic brain injuries.
drug.mechanism-of-action: DP-b99 is a discovery product, rationally designed using D-Pharmâ€™s proprietary technology, Membrane Active Chelators (MAC). Considerable evidence suggests that redistribution of metal ions and disturbances in metal ion homeostasis are key components in the cascade of events underlying cell damage in stroke. In the first hours post-stroke ion disturbances cause excitatory cell damage and in the days and weeks following they contribute to edema, inflammation and cell death. DP-b99 is a novel approach to neuroprotection based on selective modulation of calcium, zinc, copper and iron homeostasis in the vicinity of cell membranes.
